item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 29, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. GitHub cuts AI deals with Google, Anthropic (516 points | 308 comments)
2. OpenAI builds first chip with Broadcom and TSMC, scales back foundry ambition (96 points | 47 comments)
3. Using an 8K TV as a Monitor (226 points | 262 comments)
4. RIP botsin.space (20 points | 4 comments)
5. Digging into PlantStudio, a Bit Late (74 points | 7 comments)
6. Writing in Pictures: Richard Scarry and the art of children's literature (189 points | 84 comments)
7. Launch HN: Integuru (YC W24) – Reverse-engineer internal APIs using LLMs (127 points | 49 comments)
8. Show HN: Kasama – an IntelliJ plugin to keep track of your coding practices (54 points | 17 comments)
9. How to get the whole planet to send abuse complaints to your best friends (309 points | 65 comments)
10. Ancient Monkey: Pwning a 17-Year-Old Version of SpiderMonkey (69 points | 2 comments)
11. Scythe Works Without Borders (40 points | 20 comments)
12. When are two proofs essentially the same? (2007) (42 points | 63 comments)
13. Jump Trading, Virtu and the 'hidden optical fibre cable' under an Ohio field (20 points | 4 comments)
14. Vector databases are the wrong abstraction (95 points | 11 comments)
15. The electrostatic world of insects (138 points | 43 comments)
16. InspectMind AI (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
17. A deep history of Halloween (98 points | 27 comments)
18. Programming a computer for playing chess (1950) [pdf] (80 points | 23 comments)
19. PhD student finds lost city in Mexico jungle (85 points | 49 comments)
20. AgiBot X1, a modular humanoid robot with high dof (8 points | discuss)
21. Generative AI could generate tons of e-waste by decade's end (11 points | 4 comments)
22. Why Slight Failed: A Slight Post-Mortem (114 points | 48 comments)
23. Trying Arroost (13 points | 1 comment)
24. Teri Garr, Star of 'Young Frankenstein' and 'Tootsie,' Dies at 79 (48 points | 15 comments)
25. Omnivore Is Joining ElevenLabs (66 points | 24 comments)
26. Show HN: Latex.to – LaTeX to image converter running in the browser (61 points | 32 comments)
27. Strava was used to locate the most powerful people (51 points | 41 comments)
28. Show HN: Basis – a production focused robotics framework (72 points | 33 comments)
29. Who is the skeleton buried by a secret society under this Baltimore bar? (24 points | 30 comments)
30. GLP-1 for Everything (113 points | 160 comments)
